original_title: City Scoop: Trump awed in meeting with Mamdani, and other top stories across NYC
english_summary: Federal immigration enforcement operations will escalate in New York City, White House advisor Tom Homan announced, citing the city's sanctuary policies. Following this, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents reappeared on Canal Street on Saturday, nearly a month after nine people were detained in the same area. While President Trump said he will not deploy the National Guard to the city, Homan warned of an increased enforcement presence. In other news impacting daily life, MTA officials reported that a wire thief was responsible for over 700 subway delays last month. The theft significantly disrupted evening rush hour service on the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 lines. These developments occurred as President Trump and NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani held a "productive meeting" on Friday.
chinese_title: 联邦加强纽约移民执法，ICE特工重返运河街
refined_chinese_news_report:
白宫顾问汤姆·霍曼 (Tom Homan) 宣布，联邦将在纽约市升级移民执法行动。他指出，此举是针对纽约市的“庇护城市”政策。
作为执法行动的一部分，美国移民与海关执法局 (ICE) 的特工于上周六再次出现在运河街 (Canal Street)。此次行动距离上一次ICE在同一地区逮捕九人，过去了将近一个月。尽管总统特朗普表示不会向纽约市部署国民警卫队，但霍曼警告说，执法人员的出现将更加频繁。

original_title: Ex-UN diplomat talks human rights careers with Steinhardt class
english_summary: On Thursday, former United Nations diplomat David Chikvaidze visited an NYU Steinhardt human rights class to share insights from his 36-year career and advise students on entering international diplomacy. During the session, part of the "International Human Rights Activism and Education" course, students asked how to secure work and internships at organizations like the UN. Chikvaidze acknowledged that the UN lacks a clear “docking point” for young people and accepts few undergraduate interns each year. He advised students to first understand the specific position they want, then build their candidacy by focusing on personal strengths and interests. Chikvaidze also urged students to celebrate small victories and not be deterred from their goals. He shared experiences from his work in humanitarian crises, stating his hope is to maximize the positive potential of youth, whom he called a “reservoir of talent, energy and enthusiasm.”
chinese_title: 前联合国官员支招，详解国际组织求职路
refined_chinese_news_report:
上周四，前联合国外交官大卫·奇克瓦伊泽 (David Chikvaidze) 到访纽约大学斯坦哈特学院，与一堂人权课程的学生进行了交流。这次活动是“国际人权行动主义与教育”课程的一部分，他结合自己长达36年的职业生涯，为有志于进入国际外交领域的学生提供了求职建议。
针对学生们关于如何获得联合国等组织工作与实习机会的提问，奇克瓦伊泽坦言，联合国缺少一个为年轻人设立的明确“切入点”，每年只接收极少数本科实习生。他建议，学生应首先明确自己想要申请的具体职位，然后围绕个人优势和兴趣来针对性地建立自己的竞争力。
奇克瓦伊泽还鼓励学生们要学会庆祝每一个微小的胜利，不要因挫折而放弃目标。他表示，希望能够最大化发挥青年人的积极潜力，并称他们是“才华、精力与热情的储备库”。

original_title: NYU Langone awarded ‘A’ in safety for 11th time
english_summary: NYU Langone Health has received an "A" grade for patient safety for the 11th consecutive time from The Leapfrog Group, a national nonprofit organization. This top rating, awarded in the fall 2025 survey, applies to its main hospitals in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Long Island, while its Suffolk location advanced from a “C” to a “B.” The grades are based on 30 patient safety measures, and only 23% of New York state hospitals earned an "A." This recognition follows a September report that ranked NYU Langone No. 1 in patient care for the fourth year in a row. The health system also announced expansions, including six new medical centers in Suffolk County and a proposed $83 million emergency department expansion in Kips Bay. Despite these achievements, the article notes the hospital has faced criticism over patient care accessibility and employee lawsuits alleging discrimination.
chinese_title: NYU医院安全评级，再获最高A级
refined_chinese_news_report:
全国性非营利组织The Leapfrog Group公布了最新的患者安全评级，纽约大学朗格尼健康中心 (NYU Langone Health) 连续第11次获得最高的“A”级评分。这项评级来自2025年秋季的调查，适用于其在曼哈顿、布鲁克林和长岛的主要医院。
该评级基于对30项患者安全措施的评估，在纽约州所有医院中，只有23%获得了“A”级。此外，其位于萨福克 (Suffolk) 的分院评级也从“C”提升至“B”。
在此之前，纽约大学朗格尼健康中心在9月的一份报告中已连续第四年被评为患者护理第一名。该医疗系统还宣布了扩张计划，包括在萨福克郡新建六个医疗中心，并计划投资8300万美元扩建其基普斯湾 (Kips Bay) 的急诊科。
然而，尽管取得了这些成就，该医院也因患者护理的可及性问题以及员工提起的歧视诉讼而面临外界批评。

original_title: Langone researchers find new way to detect nerve-killing head trauma
english_summary: Researchers at NYU Langone have discovered a method that could help predict the risk of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), a neurodegenerative disease caused by repeated head injuries. This condition, common in athletes, is currently only diagnosable through a post-mortem autopsy. The September study was a collaboration between the NYU Grossman School of Medicine and the Langone Concussion Center. Using advanced computer analysis, researchers compared the brain scans of 169 former male football players with those of 54 males without a history of head trauma. They found that former players had wider and shallower brain grooves, or sulci, with the difference being more pronounced the longer an individual had played. Lead author Hector Arciniega stated the goal is to develop a risk assessment to help physicians intervene before the disease worsens. Future research will also examine how social factors affect CTE diagnosis and treatment.
chinese_title: 纽约大学发现新方法，可预测运动员脑损伤
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学朗格尼医学中心 (NYU Langone) 的研究人员发现了一种新方法，或可用于预测慢性创伤性脑病 (CTE) 的风险。这是一种由反复头部受伤引起的神经退行性疾病，常见于运动员，此前只能通过死后尸检确诊。
这项于九月发表的研究，对比了169名前男性橄榄球运动员与54名无头部创伤史男性的脑部扫描。研究人员通过计算机分析发现，前运动员的大脑沟槽 (sulci) 更宽更浅，且职业生涯越长，这种差异越明显。
研究主要作者赫克托·阿西涅加 (Hector Arciniega) 表示，研究目标是开发一种风险评估工具，帮助医生在病情恶化前进行干预。未来的研究还将审视社会因素如何影响CTE的诊断和治疗。

original_title: COVID-19 may affect sense of smell for years, Langone study finds
english_summary: A new study by researchers at NYU Langone Health reveals that a reduced sense of smell, or hyposmia, can persist for years after a COVID-19 infection, often without the person's awareness. The research, co-led by Grossman professor Leora Horwitz, surveyed over 3,500 people using a scratch-and-sniff test. A key finding was that while 80% of individuals who suspected smell loss were impaired, a surprising 66% of those who believed their sense of smell was normal also had abnormally low test scores. Horwitz warned that this impairment has serious daily life consequences, such as an inability to detect spoiled food, gas leaks, or smoke, and can lead to malnourishment from loss of interest in eating. While there are no concrete treatments, the study noted smell training can be beneficial. Researchers recommend formal screening for long-term COVID-19 patients, even those who do not report any symptoms.
chinese_title: 新冠后遗症新发现，嗅觉丧失或在不知不觉中
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学朗格尼医学中心 (NYU Langone Health) 的一项新研究显示，新冠感染可能导致嗅觉减退持续数年，并且许多人对此并未察觉。这项研究由格罗斯曼学院教授莱奥拉·霍洛维茨 (Leora Horwitz) 共同领导，通过对超过3500人进行刮擦闻味测试得出了这一结论。
研究中的一个关键发现令人意外。在那些自认为嗅觉完全正常的参与者中，竟有66%的人在测试中的得分异常偏低。相比之下，在那些怀疑自己嗅觉受损的群体中，有80%的人被证实确实存在嗅觉障碍。
霍洛维茨警告，嗅觉损伤会给日常生活带来严重后果，例如无法察觉变质食物、煤气泄漏或烟雾，甚至可能因对饮食失去兴趣而导致营养不良。尽管尚无特效疗法，但研究指出嗅觉训练有一定帮助，并建议对新冠长期患者进行正式筛查，即使他们并未报告任何症状。

original_title: Silver trains social work students with virtual simulations
english_summary: A study from NYU's Silver School of Social Work has found that hybrid training models incorporating virtual simulations can help students develop practical clinical skills. The pilot initiative, which began in 2023 as a two-semester class, aims to address a 15.6% vacancy rate for mental health providers in New York City. In the program, social work students practiced interviewing subjects on sensitive topics like suicide risk assessments in a low-stakes, non-harmful environment. Professors Anne Dempsey and Nicholas Lanzieri highlighted that this allows students to receive critical feedback not always available during internships due to patient confidentiality rules. While the study noted some students felt anxious with automated feedback, Silver is now collaborating with the Tandon and Steinhardt schools to launch a fully AI-powered virtual reality simulation this spring for students to engage with "avatar" patients.
chinese_title: 纽约大学新举措，AI助力社工培训
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学(NYU)社会工作学院(Silver School of Social Work)的一项研究显示，采用虚拟模拟的混合培训模式有助于学生发展实用的临床技能。该试点项目于2023年启动，是一个为期两学期的课程，旨在应对纽约市心理健康服务提供者高达15.6%的职位空缺率。
在该项目中，社会工作专业的学生可以在一个低风险的环境中，练习处理自杀风险评估等敏感话题的访谈技巧。项目负责人安妮·邓普西 (Anne Dempsey) 和尼古拉斯·兰齐耶里 (Nicholas Lanzieri) 教授强调，这种模式让学生能获得关键反馈，而这些反馈在实习中因患者保密规定通常无法获得。
尽管研究提到部分学生对自动化反馈感到焦虑，但Silver学院目前正与坦登工程学院(Tandon School of Engineering)和斯坦哈特学院(Steinhardt School)合作。他们计划于今年春季推出一个完全由人工智能驱动的虚拟现实模拟项目，届时学生将能与“虚拟化身”患者进行互动。

original_title: Urban health care can’t keep up, Tandon study finds
english_summary: A September study by researchers at NYU’s Tandon School of Engineering found that the growth of medical specialists in large cities is failing to keep pace with rising populations, resulting in significant healthcare access issues. Based on data from over 1.4 million providers nationwide, the research highlighted that New York City has only 4.7 specialists per 1,000 residents. Researchers state this low ratio undermines care, especially for conditions common among older adults. According to lead author Tian Gan, a Tandon Ph.D. candidate, geriatric care providers like urology specialists scale particularly slowly. This trend leads to consequences for urban residents, including longer wait times, bounced referrals, and an overreliance on primary care. The study suggests these shortages may lead to "medical tourism," requiring patients to travel for specialized care.
chinese_title: NYU研究揭示，纽约专科医生严重短缺
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学坦登工程学院 (NYU’s Tandon School of Engineering) 九月发布的一项研究显示，大城市专科医生的增长速度未能跟上人口增长，导致了医疗服务可及性问题。该研究分析了全美超过140万名医疗服务提供者的数据，指出纽约市每1000名居民仅拥有4.7名专科医生，这一比例严重影响了医疗服务的供给。
研究的主要作者、坦登学院博士生甘天 (Tian Gan) 指出，老年护理相关的专科医生，如泌尿科专家，数量增长尤其缓慢。这种趋势的直接后果是，城市居民面临更长的看病等待时间、转诊困难，并且被迫更加依赖初级保健医生。
该研究认为，专科医生短缺的现象最终可能导致“医疗旅游”的出现，迫使患者需要跨地区寻求专业治疗。

original_title: NYU awaits guidance on admissions data release
english_summary: New York University is awaiting federal guidance on a new Trump administration requirement mandating the submission of detailed applicant data, which begins December 3. This initiative requires universities to provide six years of data on applicant race, sex, test scores, and GPAs to the Department of Education to ensure compliance with the ban on race-based admissions. According to NYU spokesperson Joseph Tirella, the university must comply or risk losing up to $1.5 billion in federal funding, which supports research grants and student aid. Following the 2023 Supreme Court ruling against affirmative action, NYU saw Asian student enrollment increase from 22% to 27%, while Black and Latino enrollment fell. This policy adds to financial pressures, as NYU has already lost at least $6 million in grants since certain federal aid was suspended.
chinese_title: 纽约大学面临新规，须提交六年申请数据
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学正在等待联邦政府关于一项新规的指导意见，该规定要求学校从12月3日起提交详细的申请人数据。这项由特朗普政府发起的政策，要求大学向教育部提供长达六年的申请人种族、性别、考试成绩和GPA数据。
这项政策的目的是确保大学遵守禁止在招生中考虑种族因素的禁令。纽约大学发言人约瑟夫·蒂雷拉 (Joseph Tirella) 表示，学校必须遵守规定，否则可能损失高达15亿美元的联邦资金，这笔资金用于支持研究经费和学生援助。
这项新规是在最高法院2023年做出反对平权法案的裁决后出台的。在该裁决之后，纽约大学的亚裔学生入学率从22%上升到27%，而黑人和拉丁裔学生的入学率则有所下降。这项数据提交要求也加剧了学校的财务压力，因为此前部分联邦援助暂停已使该校损失了至少600万美元的拨款。
